Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: Speaking, writing, understanding basic italian.
This course gave me a really good grasp of beginner Italian, from verbs to nouns and basic sentence structure.

It was only the first semester, so I obviously don't know a ton yet. However, the things we have covered so far I feel comfortable writing and speaking about because everything was integrated as we went along.

I learned basic Italian grammar: nouns, adjectives, and verbs in the present tense, passato prossimo, trapassato prossimo, and imperfect tenses. I learned basic conversational skills and about Italian customs and culture.
Became somewhat conversational in Italian and developed my general communication skills.
Basic Italian comprehension and speaking skills
I applied the basic grammar rules and vocabulary of Italian in writing compositions, developed my conversational skills, and learned about Italian culture.
I learned the basics of the Italian.

Basic Italian grammar (nouns, verb tenses, types of pronouns, direct and indirect object pronouns, interrogatives, etc.) and vocabulary. Gained experience in writing compositions (temas) and speaking through in-class conversations and a final presentation.
Lots of Italian!
Great teacher, some standardization of tests and quizzes across the L1 classes might be helpful.
I think the conversation activities and temi were very helpful. I also liked the format of having quizzes before the tests. However, I think that we sometimes used too many worksheets.
I thought I learned a lot from the speaking and other activities we did in class. Also, I thought that the time put into the class was very effective for learning.

This is a great introductory course. There is a good mix between learning grammar through exercises and speaking out loud. The Italian department is wonderful, so you learn a lot without it being too intimidating- they do a great job of making the learning enjoyable. The only thing that I didn't like was the online workbook exercises.
The course is quite easy, and I think it could be improved by adding more oral elements.

Strengths- immersive 

Weaknesses- moves very fast

I loved that the course was very engaging, and speaking Italian during class made me feel more comfortable with the vocabulary and grammar. The weekly writing assignments were helpful, and I'm tremendously grateful for my professor's feedback.
My strength was my ability to understand the grammar and combining all grammar together.

Strengths: the course meets every day, so it is easy to retain the material learned and review, not a lot of homework, frequent assessments (sounds bad, but less material per test/quiz). Weaknesses: Sometimes we wouldn't spend enough time on difficult concepts and too much time on easy concepts.
Strengths: Italian 110 is not overly demanding, which I appreciated very much. I obtained a great foundation to a new language. No weaknesses.
Yes it was a great course and I learned alot.
Yes, I really liked Teresa and I really learned a lot in such a short amount of time.
I would recommend this course. I really enjoyed going to class and think I learned a lot during the semester.

Yes, I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. Italy is a beautiful country with incredible culture and the language is fairly easy to learn, especially if you have experience in another romance language. It is a fun class, and although it meets every day, it isn't too much work or overwhelming in any way. You definitely get out of it what you put into it.
Yes, it's a relaxed and fun way to learn Italian.
Yes

Yes, I'd absolutely recommend this course!!  This class is a great introduction to Italian, and it's fairly manageable. The engaging class activities and compositions truly helped me hone my speaking and writing skills.
I really enjoyed Italian and would recommend it to someone who wants to learn a new language.
Italian is a beautiful language, and I would recommend anyone to take it for its own sake, not because it is (supposedly) easy.
Yes, if you'd like to take a modern foreign language that is beautiful to speak and not overly demanding.
